title: How hot should my GPU be while gaming? - Quora

response.answer_text: No component, GPU included, should exceed 90 °C at any time. As long you’re below that – you’re fine. That doesn’t mean that if the temperature happens to go higher your hardware will get destroyed or damaged. If operation limits are exceeded, processing units reduce their performance by themselves in order to reduce the temperature. In extreme cases they will automatically shut down.

If your GPU exceed 80 celcius while you play any game, then you should check your cooling systems and air flow in your computer. If you don’t have graphic card like a Quadro or FireGL, which they are much more resilient aganist heat, then you should keep your GPU under 80 celsius.
